newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian sugar falls on sluggish demand,fresh stocks.
newsitem.headline: Indian sugar falls on sluggish demand,fresh stocks.

text.p: Indian sugar prices fell on Thursday on sluggish consumer demand and fresh arrivals, dealers said.
In ready delivery sugar S-30 fell by five rupees at 1,245/1,270 rupees per quintal while M-30 lost 10 rupees at 1,280/1,350 rupees.
Arrivals remained higher amid fresh offerings by mill owners due to lower outstation buying. Sugar mill delivery was steady at 1,185/1,200 rupees per quintal.
Dealers said the free sale quota for this month is 700,000 tonnes against 650,000 tonnes released in January.
"The higher quota also triggered higher offerings by the mill owners ahead of month-end," one broker said.
